This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/133386#issuecomment-1303042598 - Please add this rule:
```adblock
facebook.com,facebookcorewwi.onion#%#!function(){ var b=0,d=[];new MutationObserver(function(){document.querySelectorAll("div[data-pagelet^=\"FeedUnit\"]:not([style*=\"display: none\"]), div[role=\"feed\"] > div:not([style*=\"display: none\"]), div[role=\"feed\"] > span:not([style*=\"display: none\"]), #ssrb_feed_start + div > div[class]:not([style*=\"display: none\"]), #ssrb_feed_start + div span > h3 ~ div[class]:not([style*=\"display: none\"]), #ssrb_feed_start + div h3~ div[class]:not([style*=\"display: none\"]), #ssrb_feed_start + div h3 ~ div > div[class]:not([style*=\"display: none\"])").forEach(function(e){Object.keys(e).forEach(function(a){if(a.includes("__reactEvents")||a.includes("__reactProps")){a=e[a];try{if(a.children?.props?.category?.includes("SPONSORED")||a.children?.props?.children?.props?.category?.includes("SPONSORED")||a.children?.props?.children?.props?.feedEdge?.category?.includes("SPONSORED")){b++,e.style="display: none !important;";var f=e.querySelector("a[href][aria-label]:not([aria-hidden])");f&&(d.push(["Ad blocked based on property ["+b+"] -> "+f.ariaLabel]),console.table(d))}}catch(a){}}})})}).observe(document,{childList:!0,subtree:!0})}();
```
to user rules.
It should hides sponsored posts.

issue.title: www.bing.com

labels.name: T: Anti Adblock Script
labels.description: The site detects ad blocking

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Anti Adblock Script) [https://www.bing.com/search?q=fritz+dect+302&go=Suche&qs=ds&form=QBRE](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.bing.com%2Fsearch%3Fq%3Dfritz%2Bdect%2B302%26go%3DSuche%26qs%3Dds%26form%3DQBRE) ### Comment Username: @tox1c90 > I think I understand now what the problem is that in some cases Bing ads are slipping through. Just noticed by chance that ALL of my search results are served as IMAGES/blobs instead of text. Only the headlines and URLs can be selected and copied as text, the actual preview of each result including the "ad" marker is contained in an image object, if you try to select the text with your mouse/cursor one actually drags the whole thing around. > This is not only the case for ads, but for all search results when Adguard is enabled. > > In inPrivate mode of the browser, this does not happen, and all search results are served as proper selectable text. And then, Adguard is able to block all ads. > > So the ads are obviously not missed by the filter, but it's Bing running some kind of Adblock detection, which switches the way search results are delivered from text mode to small inline images/snippets/blobs. > > Anything one can do to get around this? Better way of hiding Adguard? ### Screenshots

### Issue URL (Ads) [http://rezka.ag](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=http%3A%2F%2Frezka.ag) ### Comment > Смотрела было все ок, только сильно подвисало постоянно, на сайте прямым текстом написано, что если вы используете блокировщики рекламы, сайт будет виснуть. Мне это надоело, я решила полазить в настройках вашего приложения, вдруг найду что-то полезное. Наклацала непонятно что, вроде вернула все обратно, но теперь вылезла проблема - законные две рекламы вернулись к моим просмотрам сериалов и фильмов. При этом на самом сайте много всплывающих окон и баннеров, их по прежнему не видно. Что я наклацала не знаю, в самом сафари расширение включено, с настроек все включено, если в приложение зайти то там стоит защита сафари включена. А по факту лажа. Хелп, сама я не могу разобраться. ### Screenshots

comment.body:
@ryanbr Could you please take a look?
Content is hidden due to this rule:
```adblock
###backTop:not(html):not(body)
```
from `Fanboy's Annoyances` filter.

<hr>

Temporary solution for user rules:
```adblock
ouchn.cn#@##backTop:not(html):not(body)
```

comment.body:
On iOS content blockers work only in Safari.
You can enable DNS filtering and add DNS filters in settings or set AdGuard DNS as a DNS server to block some ads in other web browsers, but DNS filtering is limited and ad leftovers/placeholders, some ads and other elements will not be blocked.

comment.body:
@piquark6046 I mean that this rule:
```adblock
upinews.kr##.viewSns
```
causes that these icons are hidden.

I mean these icons:
<details><summary>Screenshot</summary>

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29142494/200016179-1a5fc55d-ab83-416d-aac6-0d8b2843d2fe.png)

</details>

That how it looks like if I add `upinews.kr##.viewSns` to user rules:
<details><summary>Screenshot</summary>

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29142494/200016466-5f6947c0-7b47-4aa0-b9ec-393b4d5d8635.png)

</details>

So, I proposed a different rules which should not hide those buttons:
```adblock
upinews.kr##.viewSns > ul:not(.font)
upinews.kr###viewWrap > .viewSns
```
Second rule is needed for mobile view.
